bibl.title: Letter, Southgate Cregmile in Nashville, Tenn. to Mother, 1862, July 14
bibl.note: 1862 July 14 Southgate Cregmile in Nashville, Tenn. to his Mother (Eleanor Griffin). Assures her that everyone there is well. Camping in town, where both the thirty day guard duty and the place they are staying pleases him. Purged an abandoned house of its contents producing a wagon load of hidden army uniforms, guns, even several bolts of muslin cloth. Provost guard on high alert because of a three thousand member enemy cavalry camped only three miles up river.

div.p: I set down to rite you a few lines to let you know how we are all getting a longe. we are all well at presant we are Campt in town we have a good place to stand garde and a good place to stay in we stay in a building that the students were in be four the fedderles took the town. I took a past

in town for thirsty days to garde we took a wagon load of reeish dress coats and shoes boots double bearld shot guns and five or six bolts of musland and a new Carpet. they had them hid in a house a longe the river. old Morgan is up the river three miles with three thousand Calvery. there were tow regt Came in town to help to fight them if thay go to come in town.
This is all I halft to say this time
